###5.5

At the end of a performance experiment, the main Performance Analyzer window appears.
Drag your mouse over the Performance Analyzer window to learn more about its features. Click the bottom right arrow when you are done.
The Function List displays functions with performance data, in this case, time spent in the function and in the functions it called.  Double-clicking a function displays the source code in Source View (or Main View) annotated with the performance data.
The Usage Chart indicates general resource usage during the experiment.
The Time Line indicates events occuring in the experiment as tick marks.  Clicking an event identifies it.  Double-clicking an event displays the associated call stack.  The calipers let you limit the scope of the analysis.  The controls let you move the calipers and selected event.
Caliper and sample point selector controls.
